Incidentally, cutaneous lesions related to SARS‐CoV‐2 and referred to as COVID toes, have been reported.
42 With geriatric patients having a weak immune response, dermatological manifestations may offer some clues during screening. A recent report highlighted an irregular oral ulcer, suspected to be the inaugural oral symptom for SARS‐CoV‐2.
43 However, this needs to be observed in a larger cohort of patients before confirmation.
